results.Title: View
results.JobResponsibilities:
• Minimum 5 years of experience in positions requiring understanding of performance of Quality functions for logistics support services projects and continuous process improvement
• Experience supporting federal organization
results.Qualifications:
Project Manager – Position Description
Armedia is seeking a qualified Project Manager (PM) to provide support for a Federal Client in Washington, D.C.  The PM supervises a staff of approximately 15 people performing document and records management activities.
The Project Manager oversees the ongoing regular operation of the document and records management activities.  Within this management framework, the PM ensures that required quality levels are maintained and schedule dates are met.  To these ends, the Project Manager:
• Manages workflow across numerous document and records management support tasks ensuring that staff resources are properly deployed at any given time to meet cost, quality and timing objectives. 
• Implements established quality assurance and control procedures to ensure that rigorous quality standards are routinely met and errors are promptly corrected.
• Promotes quality culture and policies by training the workforce in quality principles and objectives.
• Interfaces with employees and customers to facilitate corrective action responses and reports.
• Maintains and oversees operational performance metrics.
• Interfaces with other functions to analyze data and provide solutions for quality issues.
• Provides Quality leadership in the development/implementation of Standard Operating Procedures.
• Implements a Risk Management Plan associated with the aforementioned activities.
• Develops, maintains, and reports performance metrics which effectively measure the level of performance in execution of the PWS. 
• Collects metrics to monitor and optimize project performance.
• Performs other duties and assignments as required.
The Project Manager reviews progress and labor accounting reports (including time sheets) and prepares the content included in the Weekly and Monthly Status Reports for customer review.  The Project Manager collects metrics to monitor and optimize project performance.
Minimum Qualifications:
Education/Certifications:  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. One year related experience may be substituted for one year of education.
ISO 9001 experience highly desirable.

results.Title: View
results.JobResponsibilities:
BS or MS Degree in IT field with 1-5 years’ experience developing PHP-based Web Content applications.
• Proficient with PHP, HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, LAMP Stack, basic Linux/Windows Administration.
• Solid understanding of SQL query and Relational Database (MySQL and MS SQL Server preferred, Sqlite, PostgreSQL, Oracle acceptable) and basic database tuning.
• Proficient utilizing IDE for application development (Eclipse, Visual Studio .NET, etc.)
• Proficient with Web Services, RESTful API and XML.
• Hands-on developer experience on open source Wiki technologies (MediaWiki customization experience desired).
• Comfortable working and multi-tasking in a fast-paced team environment.
results.Qualifications:
Job Description:
Exciting opportunity to make a real difference and chanllenge yourself in building an Enterprise-level, Wikipedia.org-like, online content database solutions utilizing open source MediaWiki and Alfresco technologies.
This position is for a Mid-level PHP Developer and will require hands-on Web and software application development.
Must have 1-5 year of PHP Web development experience, at least 6 month project (in production) experience developing Web application using PHP and MySQL.            
Must have coding/development experience related to customizing Web Wiki (MediaWiki highly desirable).
Accountability:
The Web Developer is accountable for but not limited to the following:
• Translating the requirements from the business analyst into testable, re-usable Web components within selected Web technology framework.
• Collaborating with the Alfresco lead developer in the design and development of the Web integration services required to interact with Alfresco platform.
• Supporting client personnel to identify potential PHP Web application enhancements.
• Provides scope, sizing and estimates time required to complete code and provides this information to the project manager for input to the project plan. Determines impacts and integration points. May participate in capacity planning with project manager or functional manager.
• Provides Subject Matter Expertise (SME) input to fellow IT staff on PHP Web designs, architecture, and testing.
• Researches and recommends solutions to client requirements, as needed.
• Configuration, administration, environment management, customization, development of web applications using web tools and LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL/MSSQL, PHP).
Working Conditions:
• Work Hours: Regular Business Hours
• Location: On client site (Alexandria, VA, but near Bailey’s Cross Road/Route 7 and 395)
• Length: 6 months
• Job Title: Developer I
• Salary/Rate: DOE
• Expected start date: January 2013 (Contingent upon funding approval)
Communication Skills:
• Interpret and/or discuss information with others, which involves terminology or concepts not familiar to many people; regularly provide advice and recommend actions involving rather complex issues. May resolve problems within established practices.
• Ability to communicate with teammates and clients, encourage acceptance of ideas, and articulate basic and advanced technical concepts in both written and verbal formats.
Object-oriented concept and design patterns
• Experience with Alfresco Enterprise Content Management (ECM) PHP SDK, Documentum, or other Web Content Management (e.g. Drupal, Joomla, or SharePoint)
• Previous electronic document publishing experience
• Experience with Java EE, VMWare, Linux
• Knowledge of Handbook online authoring and digitization/OCR
• Familiar with software development process (SCRUM, CMMI, Agile Methodologies, RUP, XP etc.)
• Zend PHP Certification a big plus
• Ability to work within, and adapt quickly in either a team environment or individually to meet deliverables/schedules

results.Qualifications:
5+ years of business analyst experience working with enterprise level content management solutions such as Documentum, Filenet, Sharepoint, or Alfresco.
•         Proven ability to manage requirements timeline, issues and risks and the ability to manage and mentor junior BA’s on the project.
•         Solid understanding of the SDLC and working with teams throughout the lifecycle.
•         Ability to identify and propose solutions for business needs.
•         Experience collecting, analyzing and documenting use cases and requirements from various user groups.
•         Experience working with one or more requirements gathering tools such as Contour, CaliberRM, and RequisitePro through which requirements are tracked, traced, and documented.
•         Demonstrated success of requirements lifecycle including:  conducting analysis, achieving consensus, perform traceability, prioritization, verification, creation of formal documentation/deliverables (SRS, RTM, Use Cases), effective manage change control.
•         Ability to communicate effectively between technical and non-technical groups.
•         Act as the liaison/customer advocate during full requirements lifecycle (analysis, documentation, development, and test).
•         Proven ability to lead multiple user-focused, functional requirements workshops.
•         Proven ability to provide knowledge transfer and end-user training
•         Excellent interpersonal, organizational, written communication, oral communication and listening skills.
•         Excellent analytical skills.
•         Must be self-motivated and results-oriented.
•         Significant Content Management experience is strongly preferred.
•         Technical experience strongly preferred.
•         Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science preferred or analysis related field acceptable.

results.JobResponsibilities:
The Analyst is accountable for but not limited to the following:

• Collecting and defining requirements from the business users into testable user stories and test scripts.
• Experience with requirements, design and development processes.
• Represent business users and business owners to the development process.
• Collaborate with the Alfresco development team in the design and development of the Web integration services required to interact with Alfresco platform.
• Coordinate with lead Business Analyst on workload and priorities.
• Researches and recommends solutions to client requirements, as needed.
• Collect, convert, load and monitor content in various forms in a MediaWiki environment.
results.Qualifications:
BA/BS Degree with experience as a business analyst, test engineer or quality analyst.

• Comfortable working and multi-tasking in a fast-paced team environment.
Additional Desired Skills:
• Federal government IT project
• MediaWiki or other Wiki reference applications
• Experience with Alfresco Enterprise Content Management (ECM)
• Previous electronic document publishing experience
• Experience Agile/Scrum development
• Knowledge of Handbook online authoring and digitization/OCR
• Ability to work within, and adapt quickly in either a team environment or individually to meet deliverables/schedules

results.Title: View
results.JobResponsibilities:
Candidates must thrive in a self-organized team, proactively complete work – even if it is not directly assigned, and have good communication skills in order to articulate issues and solutions to customers and team members. The selected candidates will have strong problem solving skills (innovation, collaboration, analysis, inductive reasoning) and a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and drive to be successful. In addition, the individual will be part of the Engineering team with the scope to include both large and small scale customer-driven projects and enterprise infrastructure and operational projects. Individual will be expected to own and manage complex projects from inception to completion including technical assessments, architectural design and planning, integration, testing, and implementation.
The successful candidate will manage multiple Citrix application farms and be responsible for deploying applications via Citrix, maintaining and updating the Citrix farm, and troubleshooting Citrix issues in a Microsoft Windows Server/Linux environment.
results.Qualifications:
• 5 years’ experience supporting a large Citrix environment using Microsoft Active Directory, Group Policy, and access control
• 5 years experience with Microsoft Office 2010
• 5 years experience with VMWare ESX hosts and supporting virtual machines
• Familiarity with Subversion

results.Title: View
results.JobResponsibilities:
Apply knowledge of computer concepts and techniques to develop and implement automated solutions to engineering, scientific, or business data acquisition and management problems. Responsible for developing project plans, justifications, guidelines and controls. Review and manage system design to ensure it covers system requirements and/or system requirements are updated. Review and manage system implementation to ensure it covers system design and/or system requirements and designs are updated. Responsible for technical roadmaps and system infrastructure including infrastructure design, implementation, and maintenance.
Ability to perform system analysis and technology recommendations. Review team designs and implementation deliverables. Apply advanced knowledge of computer concepts, techniques, and documents product suite to design, develop and implement automated solutions to imaging, content/document management, engineering, and management problems. Also responsible for enterprise architecture planning, capacity planning, logical and physical architecture specifications, justifications guidelines, and controls. Develop alternative approaches to design, test, and evaluation techniques for solving automation problems. Able to perform enterprise system analyses and provide technology recommendations.
results.Qualifications: A minimum of six years of experience in providing services related to infrastructure; development processes; and scope- and requirements processes. Extensive experience with designing technical solutions within various business processes.

results.Qualifications:
At least six years of experience in providing Federal Acquisition
Regulation related Acquisition Management Support services that are similar in scope and complexity as required hereunder. Demonstrated experience developing cost estimates and evaluating cost proposals, developing Performance Work Statements and Quality Assurance Surveillance Plans on large, complex, technical projects using Information Technology and/or statistical software and services.
